clinical_barriers: Delayed wound healing due to Diabetes
Stalled Physical Therapy progress due to surgical wound presence
Partial amputation of 4th and 5th digits (R) foot

bureaucratic_steps: Medicare 'Binary' Billing Restriction: Inability to pay for PN service and Vascular Surgeon visits simultaneously

timeline_deltas.context: Facility hoped to keep patient longer than originally anticipated due to diabetes-related slow healing.
Original discharge planned for Oct 19 (100-day limit); patient exited Oct 11.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Patient insists on weekly Vascular Surgeon visits
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: De-prioritized/Removed PN service as an option
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Loss of conversion; patient chose specialist over home health agency
Insufficient time to build trust or pivot from competitor (Ohioans)

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Patient plans to leave AMA on Oct 8
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Contacted Ohioans Home Health to confirm admission
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Confirmed patient had existing history with competitor

rank_1_best_practices.context: Patient departing with unhealed surgical wound
rank_1_best_practices.action: Contacted Ohioans Home Health (competitor) to confirm follow-up
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Ensured clinical handoff despite loss of business

rank_1_best_practices.action: Correctly identified Medicare exclusion for concurrent Vascular Surgeon/HHA billing

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Initial visit occurred at the end of a 3-month stay
rank_0_boundary_failures.error_type: Passive - Delayed introduction prevented relationship building

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Unaware of why state transition was recorded as 'Home' vs 'Transfer'

unscripted_chaos_signals: Competitor Loyalty (Prior history with Ohioans Home Health)
Medicare Billing Guideline constraints (Hybrid model prohibited)
